intro: Warreella venusta, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of multiple small leaflets, and it produces pods that contain seeds. Warreella venusta plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
